- If a Democratic candidate wins the next presidential election, he or she will be a much less supportive president to Israel than was Donald Trump . This is particularly true for Bernie Sanders – the favorite of some prominent American Muslim antisemities – and Elizabeth Warren. Should Israel sit back and wait for whatever happens? This question should have been asked long ago. Yet, even if it is late in the game, that doesn’t mean that our government should not take actions. - If a Democratic president reverses some of Trump’s measures it may be unpleasant, but not more. Moving the American Embassy back to Tel Aviv once it has been in Jerusalem is of secondary importance. Where Israel is truly vulnerable is at the UN Security Council. In his last days as president, Barack Obama acted against president-elect Trump’s request and decided not to veto an anti-Israel resolution. - Democratic President Joe Biden's administration approved the potential sale of $735 million in weapons to Israel earlier this year, and sent it to Congress for formal review on May 5, giving lawmakers 15 days to object under laws governing foreign weapons sales. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/us-house-democrats-offer-resolution-blocking-735-million-israel-weapons-sale-2021-05-19/ published on 2021-05-19 18:30:54
correction_response:
This tweet is misleading. The resolution introduced by six Democrats was not calling for an end to the State of Israel, but rather seeking to block a $735 million sale of precision-guided weapons to Israel. The resolution was a response to the conflict between Israel and Gaza's ruling Hamas group, with the lawmakers expressing concern about the potential for these weapons to fuel the conflict. The aim was to promote peace and prosperity for both Israelis and Palestinians, not to end the State of Israel. 
References: 
https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/us-house-democrats-offer-resolution-blocking-735-million-israel-weapons-sale-2021-05-19/
https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/05/20/sen-bernie-sanders-introduce-resolution-disapproval-735-million-us-arms-sale-israel/
note_1_text: This is either a fabrication or a misinterpretation of a proposed resolution that does no such thing.    The actual resolution would simply seek to recognize the Nakba and Palestinian refugees' rights.    https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-resolution/1123/text?r=15&s=1
note_2_text: No such bill appears to exist.  Most likely, it is a bad faith misreading of this    https://www.aljazeera.com/amp/news/2022/5/16/us-congress-rashida-tlaib-introduces-nakba-resolution

3. Recent resolutions introduced by Democrats about Israel
refute_evidences: - Democratic U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday introduced a resolution seeking to block a $735 million sale of precision-guided weapons to Israel, a symbolic response to conflict between Israel and Gaza's ruling Hamas group. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/us-house-democrats-offer-resolution-blocking-735-million-israel-weapons-sale-2021-05-19/ published on 2021-05-19 18:30:54

- Reps. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-N.Y.), Mark Pocan (D-Wis.) and Rashida Tlaib (D-Mich.) introduced a similar resolution on Wednesday opposing the sale of weapons to the Israeli government. House Foreign Affairs Committee Democrats are expected to summon a senior Biden administration official to a meeting as soon as Thursday to discuss the arms deal. Reference: https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/05/20/sen-bernie-sanders-introduce-resolution-disapproval-735-million-us-arms-sale-israel/ published on 2021-05-20 10:15:56

- Representatives Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Mark Pocan and Rashida Tlaib were lead sponsors of the measure, which has at least six other co-sponsors including some of the most left-leaning Democrats in the House. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/business/aerospace-defense/us-house-democrats-offer-resolution-blocking-735-million-israel-weapons-sale-2021-05-19/ published on 2021-05-19 18:30:54

- Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) introduced a resolution on Thursday disapproving of the U.S. sale of $735 million in precision-guided weapons to Israel, according to a draft obtained by The Washington Post. The resolution aims to halt the planned sale to Israel by the Biden administration of JDAMs, or joint direct attack munitions, and small-diameter bombs, as the worst hostilities in years continue between Israel and Hamas. Reference: https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/05/20/sen-bernie-sanders-introduce-resolution-disapproval-735-million-us-arms-sale-israel/ published on 2021-05-20 10:15:56
tweet_text: Six Democrats introduced a resolution this month that called for an end to the State of Israel.
